Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add TryGetPartById" (#714) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "Add the TryGetPartById to OpenXmlPartContainer" (#712) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [x] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ ] Question on library usage

**Description**

We read some document which may lost some resource and as we know, the `OpenXmlPartContainer.GetPartById` will throw when the part with the specified id does not exist. And we can not find any API to check the specified id exist

**Information**

- .NET Target:  All
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10.1

**Repro**

```csharp
        public static void ToBrush(this BlipFill fill, OpenXmlPart part)
        {           
            if (fill.Blip != null && fill.Blip.Embed != null && fill.Blip.Embed.HasValue)
            {
                // System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: 'Specified argument was out of the range of valid values. (Parameter 'id')'
                var imagePart = part.GetPartById(fill.Blip.Embed.Value);
                
            }
``` 

**Observed**

The `GetPartById` throw ArgumentOutOfRangeException

**Expected**

We can use TryGetPartById to get the resource

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cx:chartSpace is Missing" (#675) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**cx:chartSpace is Missing**

When trying to create a histogram chart (an example of an extended chart) in office the cx:chartSpace xml element is required. A C# class for this exists in an uncompiled test which is named `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office2016.Drawing.ChartDrawing.ChartSpace`. For some reason this class isn't included in the sdk.

**Information**

- .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10

**Repro**

```csharp
DrawingsPart drawingsPart = ...;
var extendedChartPart = drawingsPart.AddNewPart<ExtendedChartPart>();

\\I want the below line to work, but the ChartSpace element doesn't exist. Also it would be nice to be able to call extendedChartPart.ChartSpace = rather than extendedChartPart.RootElement =
extendedChartPart.RootElement = new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office2016.Drawing.ChartDrawing.ChartSpace();
``` 

**Observed**

It doesn't compile and there doesn't seem to be an easy workaround

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PPTX Sunburst chart?" (#674) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
How would I go about creating a sunburst chart using OpenXML SDK? I tried reflecting it using the Productivity Tool but it would seem it does not support it correctly, and the chart itself is an image embedded into the PPTX. Seems to be stored very much differently than other types of charts.

I know this is a question and not a bug, but SO is entirely unhelpful in answering new questions, I tried asking and they just outright closed my question.
